  • Method Details

    • getLaserProperties

      public LaserProperties getLaserProperties()
      getLaserProperties returns the laser's original properties. If you want to process based on the properties the laser has, you usuallay should use getLaserOnHitProperties() instead.
      Returns:
      the LaserProperties when laser is emitting
      See Also:
      • getLaserOnHitProperties()
      • LaserProperties

    • getLaserOnHitProperties

      public LaserProperties getLaserOnHitProperties()
      getLaserOnHitProperties returns the laser's properties after hit. it should always returns same property instance on same context.
      Returns:
      the LaserProperties when laser is hit
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if laser is not fired
      See Also:
      • getLaserProperties()
      • LaserProperties

    • onHit

      protected void onHit(net.minecraft.world.phys.HitResult hit)
      onHit set the context's hit result and traveled distance
      Parameters:
      hit - The HitResult, must not be null
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the HitResult is already been set
      See Also:
      • getHitResult()
      • getTraveled()

    • canHitBlock

      public boolean canHitBlock(net.minecraft.world.level.block.state.BlockState state, net.minecraft.world.level.BlockGetter level, net.minecraft.core.BlockPos pos)
      Check if the block can block the laser
      Returns:
      true if the laser should be processed on the block, false otherwise

    • canHitEntity

      public boolean canHitEntity(net.minecraft.world.level.Level level, net.minecraft.world.entity.Entity entity)
      Check if the entity can block the laser. By default, entity will not block if:
      • the entity does not have a processor, or
      • the entity is smaller than the length of laser's red component
      Returns:
      true if the laser should be processed on the entity, false otherwise
      See Also:
      • LaserUtil.hasEntityProcessor(net.minecraft.world.entity.Entity)

    • fire

      public void fire()
      fires the laser. If the laser hit any target, this method should invoke onHit with the HitResult.

    • redirectWith

      public LaserContext redirectWith(LaserProperties props, LaserEmitter newEmitter)
